intro: Stenostephanus glaber, commonly known as the smoothstep stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped flowers, typically in shades of pink or white, during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
